*   ImmiNews. (2024, December 25). Australia Permanent Residency: New Opportunities in 2025 - Australia Immigration News | a2zimmi.com. [https://imminews.com.au/australia-permanent-residency-new-opportunities-in-2025-australia-immigration-news](https://imminews.com.au/australia-permanent-residency-new-opportunities-in-2025-australia-immigration-news)
*   ImmiNews. (2025, January 1). Australia's Migration Overhaul 2025: Key Visa Changes You Need to Know - Australia Immigration News | a2zimmi.com. [https://imminews.com.au/australias-migration-overhaul-2025-key-visa-changes-you-need-to-know](https://imminews.com.au/australias-migration-overhaul-2025-key-visa-changes-you-need-to-know)
*   iSchoolConnect. (n.d.). Australia's Post Study Visa in 2025- Types & Requirements. [https://ischoolconnect.com/blog/how-to-apply-for-a-post-study-work-visa-in-australia/](https://ischoolconnect.com/blog/how-to-apply-for-a-post-study-work-visa-in-australia/)

question_results.question:
You recruited an 18 year old student to study in a Foundation program in Australia. She has recently moved out of her homestay and into an apartment with some friends. Whose responsibility is it to ensure that the education provider has her current address?

Answer options:
The student is responsible for informing her education provider of her change of address.
The education provider is responsible for contacting the student and asking her to change her address.
DHA is responsible for contacting the student and asking her to change her address.
AEI is responsible for contacting the student and asking her to change her address.
correct_answers: The student is responsible for informing her education provider of her change of address.
extracted_answers: The student is responsible for informing her education provider of her change of address.
question_results.full_response:
## Report on Responsibility for Updating Student Address Information in Australia

**Introduction**

This report addresses the question of responsibility for ensuring that an education provider in Australia has the current address of an 18-year-old international student enrolled in a Foundation program. The scenario involves a student who has recently moved from homestay accommodation to an apartment with friends. The report will analyze relevant Australian regulations, policies, and institutional guidelines to determine whether the student, the education provider, the Department of Home Affairs (DHA), or an Australian Education International (AEI) bears the primary responsibility for maintaining accurate address information. This analysis will be conducted through a thorough examination of the Education Services for Overseas Students (ESOS) Act 2000, the National Code of Practice for Providers of Education and Training to Overseas Students 2018, and related resources.

**Analysis**

Based on the information available, the primary responsibility for informing the education provider of a change of address rests with the **student**. This conclusion is supported by multiple sources that outline the obligations of international students under Australian law and institutional policies.

**Student Responsibility**

Several sources explicitly state that international students are required to notify their education provider of any changes to their residential address within a specified timeframe, typically seven days ([UTS](https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance), [Angliss](https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/), [AdelaideUni](https://adelaideuni.edu.au/study/international-students/your-rights-as-a-student/)). This requirement is often linked to student visa conditions and compliance with the ESOS Act 2000 ([UTS](https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance), [Angliss](https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/)).

*   **Visa Condition Compliance:** International students are granted visas with specific conditions attached, one of which is maintaining accurate contact details with both the education provider and the DHA ([AdelaideUni](https://adelaideuni.edu.au/study/international-students/your-rights-as-a-student/)). Failure to comply with these conditions can lead to visa cancellation.
*   **ESOS Act and National Code:** The ESOS Act 2000 and the National Code of Practice for Providers of Education and Training to Overseas Students 2018 outline the responsibilities of both education providers and international students. While providers have obligations to support students and monitor their engagement, students are responsible for keeping their contact information up-to-date ([Angliss](https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/)).
*   **Institutional Policies:** Universities and other education providers have specific policies and procedures that require students to notify them of any changes to their contact details ([UTS](https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance), [Angliss](https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/)). These policies often specify how students can update their information, typically through online student portals.

For example, the University of Technology Sydney (UTS) explicitly states that students must notify UTS of their Australian contact details (residential address and phone number) within 7 days of arriving in Australia or after any changes ([UTS](https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance)). Similarly, William Angliss Institute requires students to notify the Institute of their current residential address, mobile number, email address, and emergency contact details within 7 days of any change ([Angliss](https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/)).

**Education Provider Responsibilities**

While the primary responsibility lies with the student, education providers also have obligations related to student contact information. These obligations include:

*   **Providing Clear Instructions:** Education providers must provide clear instructions to students on how to update their contact details ([UTS](https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance)). This typically involves providing access to online portals or designated contact points.
*   **Monitoring Student Engagement:** Providers are required to monitor student engagement and academic progress ([TEQSA](https://www.teqsa.gov.au/sector-alert-provider-responsibilities-when-using-education-agents)). If a student is not responding to communications, it may trigger a review of their contact details.
*   **Reporting Breaches:** Education providers are required to report certain changes to a student's enrolment and any breach of visa conditions to the DHA ([Angliss](https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/)). This includes instances where a student fails to maintain satisfactory contact details.
*   **Offering Support Services:** Providers are expected to offer support services to help international students adjust to life and study in Australia ([Internationaleducation](https://internationaleducation.gov.au/regulatory-information/Education-Services-for-Overseas-Students-ESOS-Legislative-Framework/National-Code/nationalcodepartd/Pages/ExplanatoryguideD6.aspx)). This can include assistance with finding accommodation and understanding their visa obligations.

However, these responsibilities do not extend to actively contacting each student to verify their address. The onus is on the student to proactively update their information.

**Department of Home Affairs (DHA) and Australian Education International (AEI)**

The DHA is responsible for managing visa applications and ensuring compliance with visa conditions ([Migrationexpert](https://www.migrationexpert.com.au/blog/updating-address-how-to-notify-immigration/)). While students are also encouraged to update their address with the DHA, the primary responsibility for informing the education provider rests with the student ([Migrationexpert](https://www.migrationexpert.com.au/blog/updating-address-how-to-notify-immigration/)). AEI is a government agency that promotes Australian education internationally. It does not have a direct role in managing student visa compliance or address updates.

**Consequences of Non-Compliance**

Failure to update contact details can have significant consequences for international students, including:

*   **Missed Communications:** Students may miss important communications from their education provider regarding course changes, assessment deadlines, or other critical information ([Migrationexpert](https://www.migrationexpert.com.au/blog/updating-address-how-to-notify-immigration/)).
*   **Visa Breach:** Failure to comply with visa conditions, including maintaining accurate contact details, can lead to visa cancellation ([AdelaideUni](https://adelaideuni.edu.au/study/international-students/your-rights-as-a-student/)).
*   **Sanctions:** Education providers may impose sanctions on students who fail to comply with their policies, such as withholding exam results or restricting access to services ([UTS](https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance)).

**Recommendations**

To ensure compliance and avoid potential issues, the following recommendations are provided:

*   **Students:** International students should proactively update their contact details with their education provider within 7 days of any change. They should also familiarize themselves with the provider's policies and procedures for updating information.
*   **Education Providers:** Education providers should provide clear and accessible instructions to students on how to update their contact details. They should also regularly remind students of their obligation to maintain accurate information.
*   **DHA:** The DHA should continue to emphasize the importance of maintaining accurate contact details as a condition of the student visa.

**Conclusion**

In the scenario presented, the 18-year-old student is primarily responsible for informing her education provider of her change of address. This responsibility is grounded in Australian visa regulations, the ESOS Act, and institutional policies. While education providers have a duty to support students and monitor their engagement, the onus is on the student to proactively update their contact information. Failure to do so can have serious consequences, including visa cancellation and academic sanctions. Therefore, it is crucial for international students to understand and comply with their obligations regarding address updates.

**Reference List**

Adelaide University. (n.d.). *Your rights as a student*. [https://adelaideuni.edu.au/study/international-students/your-rights-as-a-student/](https://adelaideuni.edu.au/study/international-students/your-rights-as-a-student/)

Angliss, W. (n.d.). *International Policies and Procedures*. [https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/](https://www.angliss.edu.au/study-with-us/international-student-info/policies-and-procedures/)

Department of Education. (2022, August 15). *International Students Factsheet*. [https://www.education.gov.au/esos-framework/resources/international-students-factsheet](https://www.education.gov.au/esos-framework/resources/international-students-factsheet)

Internationaleducation.gov.au. (n.d.). *National Code Part D, Standard 6*. [https://internationaleducation.gov.au/regulatory-information/Education-Services-for-Overseas-Students-ESOS-Legislative-Framework/National-Code/nationalcodepartd/Pages/ExplanatoryguideD6.aspx](https://internationaleducation.gov.au/regulatory-information/Education-Services-for-Overseas-Students-ESOS-Legislative-Framework/National-Code/nationalcodepartd/Pages/ExplanatoryguideD6.aspx)

Migrationexpert. (2024, April 24). *How to Update Address & Passport with DHA in Australia*. [https://www.migrationexpert.com.au/blog/updating-address-how-to-notify-immigration/](https://www.migrationexpert.com.au/blog/updating-address-how-to-notify-immigration/)

Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency (TEQSA). (2022, November 4). *Sector alert: Provider responsibilities when using education agents*. [https://www.teqsa.gov.au/sector-alert-provider-responsibilities-when-using-education-agents](https://www.teqsa.gov.au/sector-alert-provider-responsibilities-when-using-education-agents)

University of Technology Sydney (UTS). (n.d.). *International Student Compliance*. [https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance](https://www.uts.edu.au/current-students/managing-your-course/classes-and-assessment/results/student-sanctions/international-student-compliance)

question_results.question:
When a student applies for a student visa which of the following general requirements will a student NOT need to provide with the application?

Answer options:
Overseas Student Health Insurance
Knowledge of Australian culture
Arrangements for students under 18
Confirmation of Enrolment
correct_answers: Knowledge of Australian culture
extracted_answers: Knowledge of Australian culture
question_results.full_response:
## Australian Student Visa Requirements in 2025: A Detailed Analysis

The Australian government has implemented significant changes to its student visa application process, effective January 1, 2025, to ensure visa integrity and attract genuine international students ([Admission Ac Blog, 2025](https://blog.admission.ac/2025/01/05/australia-changes-rules-for-student-visas-check-new-requirement-for-a-student-visa-application/)). These changes necessitate a thorough understanding of the updated requirements for prospective students. This report aims to identify which of the given options is *not* a general requirement for an Australian student visa application in 2025, based on the provided information. The options are:

*   Overseas Student Health Insurance
*   Knowledge of Australian culture
*   Arrangements for students under 18
*   Confirmation of Enrolment

After a detailed analysis of the provided sources, it is evident that **knowledge of Australian culture** is the requirement that a student *does not* need to provide with their student visa application. While demonstrating an understanding of and willingness to uphold Australian values is necessary, proving knowledge of Australian culture is not explicitly mandated.

### Analysis of Student Visa Requirements

To justify the answer, let's examine each of the provided options in detail, referencing the source materials.

#### 1. Overseas Student Health Insurance (OSHC)

Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) is a mandatory requirement for all international students in Australia ([AECC Global, 2024](https://www.aeccglobal.com.np/blog/australia-student-visa-requirements); [IVC Services, 2024](https://ivc-services.com/blog/student-visa-requirements-for-australia)). It is a health insurance policy designed to cover potential medical costs during the student's stay in Australia ([IVC Services, 2024](https://ivc-services.com/blog/student-visa-requirements-for-australia)).

*   **Coverage:** OSHC typically covers visits to the doctor, some hospital treatments, ambulance cover, and limited pharmaceuticals ([AECC Global, 2024](https://www.aeccglobal.com.np/blog/australia-student-visa-requirements)). It generally does not cover dental, optical, or physiotherapy, for which additional insurance may be needed ([AECC Global, 2024](https://www.aeccglobal.com.np/blog/australia-student-visa-requirements)).
*   **Duration:** Students must maintain OSHC for the entire duration of their student visa ([AECC Global, 2024](https://www.aeccglobal.com.np/blog/australia-student-visa-requirements)).
*   **Obtaining OSHC:** Students can arrange OSHC through their educational institution or directly with a health insurance provider ([AECC Global, 2024](https://www.aeccglobal.com.np/blog/australia-student-visa-requirements)). The policy should start as soon as the student arrives in Australia ([AECC Global, 2024](https://www.aeccglobal.com.np/blog/australia-student-visa-requirements)).

#### 2. Knowledge of Australian Culture

While not explicitly required, applicants must sign an "Australian Values Statement," acknowledging they will uphold Australian values and laws ([VisaVerge, n.d.](https://www.visaverge.com/australiaimmigration/australian-student-visa-subclass-500-requirements-application/)). This statement implies a basic understanding of Australian societal norms and legal frameworks. However, there is no requirement to demonstrate a detailed knowledge of Australian culture, history, or arts. The focus is on adhering to the country's values and laws, rather than possessing cultural expertise.

#### 3. Arrangements for Students Under 18

Specific arrangements are required for students under 18 years of age ([VisaVerge, n.d.](https://www.visaverge.com/australiaimmigration/australian-student-visa-subclass-500-requirements-application/)). These arrangements are designed to ensure the safety and well-being of minor students studying in Australia.

*   **Guardian Nomination:** For students under 18, a nomination form (Form 157N) must be included in the visa application, nominating a guardian who will accompany them to Australia ([VisaVerge, n.d.](https://www.visaverge.com/australiaimmigration/australian-student-visa-subclass-500-requirements-application/)).
*   **Confirmation of Appropriate Accommodation and Welfare (CAAW):** Educational institutions must provide Confirmation of Appropriate Accommodation and Welfare (CAAW) for students under 18 ([VisaVerge, n.d.](https://www.visaverge.com/australiaimmigration/australian-student-visa-subclass-500-requirements-application/)). This confirms that the institution has made suitable arrangements for the student's accommodation, support, and general welfare.

#### 4. Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE)

As of January 1, 2025, a Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE) is a mandatory requirement for all Australian student visa applications, whether lodged inside or outside Australia ([Admission Ac Blog, 2025](https://blog.admission.ac/2025/01/05/australia-changes-rules-for-student-visas-check-new-requirement-for-a-student-visa-application/); [Study Australia, 2025](https://www.studyaustralia.gov.au/en/tools-and-resources/news/important-change-to-student-visa-applications-lodged-in-australi); [VisaandImmigrations, n.d.](https://visaandimmigrations.com/australias-new-student-visa-rules-for-2025-key-changes-and-what-you-need-to-know/)). This replaces the previous acceptance of Letters of Offer ([VisaandImmigrations, n.d.](https://visaandimmigrations.com/australias-new-student-visa-rules-for-2025-key-changes-and-what-you-need-to-know/)).

*   **Purpose:** The CoE is an official document issued by Australian educational institutions, confirming a student's enrollment in a registered course ([Admission Ac Blog, 2025](https://blog.admission.ac/2025/01/05/australia-changes-rules-for-student-visas-check-new-requirement-for-a-student-visa-application/)). It includes details such as student information, course of study, program duration, and tuition fees ([Admission Ac Blog, 2025](https://blog.admission.ac/2025/01/05/australia-changes-rules-for-student-visas-check-new-requirement-for-a-student-visa-application/)).
*   **Validity:** Applications submitted without a CoE are considered invalid and will not be processed ([Admission Ac Blog, 2025](https://blog.admission.ac/2025/01/05/australia-changes-rules-for-student-visas-check-new-requirement-for-a-student-visa-application/); [Study Australia, 2025](https://www.studyaustralia.gov.au/en/tools-and-resources/news/important-change-to-student-visa-applications-lodged-in-australi)).
*   **Process:** To obtain a CoE, applicants must secure admission, pay tuition fees, and receive the CoE before lodging their visa applications ([Admission Ac Blog, 2025](https://blog.admission.ac/2025/01/05/australia-changes-rules-for-student-visas-check-new-requirement-for-a-student-visa-application/)).

### Additional Key Requirements

Beyond the options provided, several other key requirements must be met for an Australian student visa application:

*   **Genuine Student (GS) Requirement:** The Genuine Student (GS) requirement, which replaced the Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) requirement on March 23, 2024, assesses the applicant's intention to study in Australia ([Kangaroo Edu, n.d.](https://kangarooedu.au/blogs/navigating-australian-student-visa-requirements-in-2025/); [Kansaz, n.d.](https://www.kansaz.in/blog/australia-study-visa-requirements)). This involves answering targeted questions about the applicant's studies, plans, and circumstances ([Kangaroo Edu, n.d.](https://kangarooedu.au/blogs/navigating-australian-student-visa-requirements-in-2025/)). The GS requirement ensures that applicants are genuine students with the primary goal of studying in Australia and potentially contributing to the Australian economy ([Kansaz, n.d.](https://www.kansaz.in/blog/australia-study-visa-requirements)).
*   **Financial Capacity:** Applicants must demonstrate sufficient financial capacity to cover tuition fees, living expenses, and travel costs ([VisaVerge, n.d.](https://www.visaverge.com/australiaimmigration/australian-student-visa-subclass-500-requirements-application/)). This ensures that students can support themselves financially during their stay in Australia. As of 2025, the required amount for an individual is AUD 29,710, with additional amounts required for partners (AUD 10,394) and children (AUD 4,449 per child) ([Leverage Edu, n.d.](https://leverageedu.com/learn/student-visa-australia-age-limit/)).
*   **English Language Proficiency:** Proof of English language proficiency is required unless the applicant falls into an exemption category ([IVC Services, 2024](https://ivc-services.com/blog/student-visa-requirements-for-australia)). This is typically demonstrated through standardized English language tests such as IELTS, TOEFL, or PTE ([IVC Services, 2024](https://ivc-services.com/blog/student-visa-requirements-for-australia)). Different institutions and courses may have varying requirements for language proficiency scores ([IVC Services, 2024](https://ivc-services.com/blog/student-visa-requirements-for-australia)). A minimum IELTS score of 6.0 is generally required for entry ([Leverage Edu, n.d.](https://leverageedu.com/learn/student-visa-australia-age-limit/)).
*   **Character and Health Requirements:** Applicants must meet character and health requirements set by the Australian government ([VisaVerge, n.d.](https://www.visaverge.com/australiaimmigration/australian-student-visa-subclass-500-requirements-application/); [Kansaz, n.d.](https://www.kansaz.in/blog/australia-study-visa-requirements)). This includes undergoing medical examinations and providing police clearance certificates from every country the applicant has lived in for 12 months or more over the last ten years ([AECC Global, 2024](https://www.aeccglobal.com.np/blog/australia-student-visa-requirements)).

### Conclusion

Based on the analysis of the provided sources, the requirement that a student does *not* need to provide with their Australian student visa application in 2025 is **knowledge of Australian culture**. While demonstrating an understanding of and willingness to uphold Australian values is necessary through the Australian Values Statement, there is no explicit requirement to prove detailed knowledge of Australian culture. The other options – Overseas Student Health Insurance, arrangements for students under 18, and Confirmation of Enrolment – are all mandatory requirements for a successful student visa application in 2025.

### References

question_results.question:
A student you recruited to study in Australia is studying a three-year Bachelor of Arts program. In her last semester the student was admitted to hospital and missed 4 weeks. She feels that she is not able to finish her program and she would like to extend her studies by one more semester. You inform the student that she:

Answer options:
Can apply for a tourist visa.
Cannot apply for an extension to her student visa.
Cannot apply for an extension to her student visa as extensions are only granted for international students studying part time.
Can apply for an extension to her student visa. The student should make an appointment with DHA to discuss the issue and bring documents with her such as her passport and a copy of her hospital records.
correct_answers: Can apply for an extension to her student visa. The student should make an appointment with DHA to discuss the issue and bring documents with her such as her passport and a copy of her hospital records.
extracted_answers: Can apply for an extension to her student visa. The student should make an appointment with DHA to discuss the issue and bring documents with her such as her passport and a copy of her hospital records.
question_results.full_response:
# Student Visa Extension Options in Australia for International Students: A Detailed Report

The scenario presented involves an international student in Australia pursuing a three-year Bachelor of Arts program who requires a visa extension due to unforeseen medical circumstances. The student's hospitalization during the last semester has led to academic setbacks, necessitating an additional semester to complete the program. This report aims to provide a comprehensive analysis of the student's options, focusing on the possibility of extending her student visa.

## Determining the Appropriate Course of Action

Based on the provided information, the most appropriate course of action for the student is to **apply for an extension to her student visa**. The student should then make an appointment with the Department of Home Affairs (DHA) to discuss the issue and bring relevant documents, such as her passport and a copy of her hospital records.

## Rationale

Several sources indicate that extending a student visa in Australia is possible under specific circumstances, such as needing more time to complete studies due to valid reasons ([Victory Group Australia](https://www.victorygroup.au/2024/12/30/student-visa-extension-in-australia-2025-key-updates-guidelines/)). The key is to demonstrate a genuine need for the extension and to meet all the necessary requirements set by the DHA.

## In-Depth Analysis of Student Visa Extensions in Australia

### General Overview

Australia remains a popular destination for international students. However, understanding the visa regulations and extension processes is crucial for those seeking to prolong their stay for academic purposes ([Victory Group Australia](https://www.victorygroup.au/2024/12/30/student-visa-extension-in-australia-2025-key-updates-guidelines/)). Instead of a simple "extension," students typically apply for a new Subclass 500 Student Visa to continue their studies ([Visafast Migration Consultancy](https://www.visafast.com.au/blog/student-visa-7/student-visa-extension-australia-23)).

### Reasons for Visa Extension

Several valid reasons may necessitate a student visa extension:

*   **Extended Course Duration:** If the course duration extends beyond the initial visa period due to changes in course structure, thesis work, or repeating subjects ([SWEC Visa Consultant](https://swecvisaconsultant.com/how-to-renew-or-extend-your-australian-student-visa/)).*   **Enrolling in a New Course:** When a student decides to enroll in a new program of study ([SWEC Visa Consultant](https://swecvisaconsultant.com/how-to-renew-or-extend-your-australian-student-visa/)).
*   **Need for Additional Coursework:** If a student struggles to meet degree requirements or needs to undertake additional subjects ([Lynx Global](https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/)).
*   **Thesis Completion:** Graduate research students may require more time than initially anticipated to complete their thesis ([Lynx Global](https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/)).
*   **Health or Personal Reasons:** Personal circumstances or health issues may delay studies ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).

In the student's case, hospitalization and the consequent inability to complete the program within the original timeframe constitute a valid reason for seeking a visa extension.

### Key Requirements and Steps for Extending a Student Visa

1.  **Eligibility Check:**
    *   Ensure enrollment in a registered course in Australia ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).
    *   Compliance with current visa conditions, including satisfactory attendance and course progress ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).
2.  **Gathering Required Documents:**
    *   **Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE):** A valid CoE from the education provider ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)). The student will need to request a fresh CoE from her educational institution ([Visafast Migration Consultancy](https://www.visafast.com.au/blog/student-visa-7/student-visa-extension-australia-23)).
    *   **Personal Documents:** Passport, identity documents, and health records ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).
    *   **Financial Evidence:** Proof of sufficient funds to support the extended stay ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)). As of May 10, 2024, students must have at least AUD 29,710 to meet living expenditures ([Visafast Migration Consultancy](https://www.visafast.com.au/blog/student-visa-7/student-visa-extension-australia-23)).
    *   **Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC):** Valid health insurance for the duration of the extended visa ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)). OSHC must be valid to cover the entire period of the new expected visa ([Deakin University](https://www.deakin.edu.au/students/student-life-and-services/international/compliance-visas/visas/how-to-apply-for-a-visa-extension)).
    *   **Personal Statement:** Explaining why continuing studies, the situation at home and in Australia, and why the course is crucial for the future ([Visafast Migration Consultancy](https://www.visafast.com.au/blog/student-visa-7/student-visa-extension-australia-23)).
    *   **Medical Records:** Documents related to the student's hospitalization, as these provide evidence of the circumstances necessitating the extension ([Lynx Global](https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/)).
3.  **Completing the Application:**
    *   Fill out the appropriate visa application form (typically Form 573 for student visas) ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).
    *   Ensure all information is accurate and complete ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).
4.  **Submitting the Application:**
    *   Submit the application online through the Department of Home Affairs website ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).
    *   Apply well in advance of the current visa’s expiration date ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)). It is suggested to start the process at least 3 to 6 months before expiration ([Visafast Migration Consultancy](https://www.visafast.com.au/blog/student-visa-7/student-visa-extension-australia-23)).
5.  **Awaiting Decision:**
    *   After submission, a confirmation will be received that the application is being processed ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).
    *   Ensure continued compliance with visa conditions during this time ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)).

### Financial Planning

Extending a student visa involves costs beyond tuition fees. These include increased visa application fees and living expenses ([Victory Group Australia](https://www.victorygroup.au/2024/12/30/student-visa-extension-in-australia-2025-key-updates-guidelines/)). Effective financial planning is essential:

*   **Create a Budget:** Account for tuition, visa fees, rent, and daily expenses ([Victory Group Australia](https://www.victorygroup.au/2024/12/30/student-visa-extension-in-australia-2025-key-updates-guidelines/)).
*   **Explore Scholarships:** Many institutions offer financial aid ([Victory Group Australia](https://www.victorygroup.au/2024/12/30/student-visa-extension-in-australia-2025-key-updates-guidelines/)).

### Potential Challenges and How to Address Them

*   **Visa Refusal:**
    *   Common reasons include insufficient documentation or discrepancies in the information provided ([Lynx Global](https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/)).
    *   Options include reapplying with additional supporting documents or appealing the decision through the Administrative Appeals Tribunal (AAT) ([Lynx Global](https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/)).
*   **Changes in Visa Policies:**
    *   Staying informed about the latest student visa extension rules and processing times is essential ([Visafast Migration Consultancy](https://www.visafast.com.au/blog/student-visa-7/student-visa-extension-australia-23)).
    *   Consulting with educational institutions for timely guidance ([Visa Verge](https://www.visaverge.com/news/australia-updates-student-visa-rules-for-2025-to-ensure-genuine-applicants/)).
*   **Maintaining Compliance:**
    *   Staying enrolled in the course, ensuring health insurance remains current, and avoiding common compliance pitfalls are critical ([Lynx Global](https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/)).
    *   Avoiding working more hours than allowed (usually 48 hours per fortnight) or failing to maintain satisfactory academic progress ([SWEC Visa Consultant](https://swecvisaconsultant.com/how-to-renew-or-extend-your-australian-student-visa/)).

### Alternatives to Student Visa Extension

While extending the student visa is the most direct approach, other options exist:

*   **Tourist Visa (Subclass 600):**
    *   Allows visiting Australia for tourism, business, or seeing family and friends ([AUM Global](https://aumglobal.com.au/blog-content/how-to-transition-from-a-tourist-visa-to-a-student-visa-in-australia)).
    *   Typically valid for 3, 6, or 12 months ([AUM Global](https://aumglobal.com.au/blog-content/how-to-transition-from-a-tourist-visa-to-a-student-visa-in-australia)).
    *   However, it does not allow working or studying for more than 3 months ([AUM Global](https://aumglobal.com.au/blog-content/how-to-transition-from-a-tourist-visa-to-a-student-visa-in-australia)).
*   **Working Holiday Visa:**
    *   Allows people aged 18-30 from approved countries to work and travel in Australia for up to 12 months ([Studies in Australia](https://www.studiesinaustralia.com/studying-in-australia/how-to-study-in-australia/student-visas/once-you-have-finished-your-studies)).
*   **Temporary Graduate Visa (Subclass 485):**
    *   Beneficial choice for staying longer in Australia after graduation ([True Blue Studies](https://truebluestudies.com.au/stay-in-australia-on-my-student-visa-after-course-completion/)).

However, these alternatives may not be suitable for the student's primary goal of completing her Bachelor of Arts program.

### The Importance of Professional Advice

Given the complexities of visa regulations, seeking professional advice from a migration agent is highly recommended ([Miracle Migration & Education](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)). A migration agent can provide tailored advice and ensure the application is submitted correctly.

## Conclusion

In conclusion, the student should pursue a student visa extension to complete her studies. She should gather all necessary documents, including a new CoE, financial evidence, OSHC, medical records, and a personal statement. Applying well in advance of her current visa's expiration date and seeking professional advice will increase her chances of a successful outcome. While alternative visa options exist, they do not align with her primary goal of finishing her Bachelor of Arts program.

## References

AUM Global. (2024, September 25). How to Transition from a Tourist Visa to a Student Visa in Australia: A Step-by-Step Guide. [https://aumglobal.com.au/blog-content/how-to-transition-from-a-tourist-visa-to-a-student-visa-in-australia](https://aumglobal.com.au/blog-content/how-to-transition-from-a-tourist-visa-to-a-student-visa-in-australia)

Deakin University. (n.d.). How to apply for a visa extension | Students. [https://www.deakin.edu.au/students/student-life-and-services/international/compliance-visas/visas/how-to-apply-for-a-visa-extension](https://www.deakin.edu.au/students/student-life-and-services/international/compliance-visas/visas/how-to-apply-for-a-visa-extension)

Lynx Global. (n.d.). Everything You Need to Know About Extending Your Australia Student Visa! [https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/](https://lynxglobal.com.au/australia-student-visa-extension/)

Miracle Migration & Education. (2024, October 2). Student Visa Extension in Australia: What You Need to Know for 2024. [https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/](https://miraclemigration.com.au/student-visa-extension-in-australia-what-you-need-to-know-for-2024/)

Studies in Australia. (n.d.). Once you have finished your studies | Study in Australia. [https://www.studiesinaustralia.com/studying-in-australia/how-to-study-in-australia/student-visas/once-you-have-finished-your-studies](https://www.studiesinaustralia.com/studying-in-australia/how-to-study-in-australia/student-visas/once-you-have-finished-your-studies)

SWEC Visa Consultant. (n.d.). How To Renew Or Extend Your Australian Student Visa. [https://swecvisaconsultant.com/how-to-renew-or-extend-your-australian-student-visa/](https://swecvisaconsultant.com/how-to-renew-or-extend-your-australian-student-visa/)

True Blue Studies. (n.d.). Stay in Australia on Student Visa After Course Completion? [https://truebluestudies.com.au/stay-in-australia-on-my-student-visa-after-course-completion/](https://truebluestudies.com.au/stay-in-australia-on-my-student-visa-after-course-completion/)

Victory Group Australia. (2024, December 30). Student Visa Extension in Australia 2025: Key Updates & Guidelines - Victory Group. [https://www.victorygroup.au/2024/12/30/student-visa-extension-in-australia-2025-key-updates-guidelines/](https://www.victorygroup.au/2024/12/30/student-visa-extension-in-australia-2025-key-updates-guidelines/)

question_results.question:
Which of the following statements is TRUE about student complaints?

Answer options:
A student must access the institution’s internal complaint process before they contact the OSO or State Ombudsman.
Students cannot complain about their agent to the OSO or State Ombudsman.
If a student contacts the OSO, the police will never investigate the complaint.
Students only the have the right to complain in certain, specified circumstances.
correct_answers: A student must access the institution’s internal complaint process before they contact the OSO or State Ombudsman.
extracted_answers: A student must access the institution’s internal complaint process before they contact the OSO or State Ombudsman.
question_results.full_response:
# Report on Student Complaint Processes in Australia

This report addresses the query regarding the truthfulness of statements about student complaints in Australia, based on provided information. The focus will be on clarifying the available avenues for complaints, the relevant ombudsman offices, and the types of issues that can be addressed.

## Determining the Correct Statement

Based on the provided information, the most accurate statement is:

**A student must access the institution’s internal complaint process before they contact the OSO or State Ombudsman.**

This conclusion is drawn from the establishment of the National Student Ombudsman (NSO) and the guidelines for international and VET students. The information suggests a tiered approach to complaint resolution, starting with the education provider's internal processes.

## Analysis of the Provided Information

### The National Student Ombudsman (NSO)

The Australian Government established the NSO, which commenced operations on February 1, 2025, following the passing of legislation on November 28, 2024 ([StudyAssist](https://www.studyassist.gov.au/news/national-student-ombudsman-commenced-1-february-2025)). The NSO is an independent and impartial body that receives escalated complaints from students about the actions of their higher education provider ([StudyAssist](https://www.studyassist.gov.au/news/national-student-ombudsman-commenced-1-february-2025)). This implies that students should first attempt to resolve their issues through the provider's internal processes before escalating to the NSO.

The NSO accepts complaints from prospective, current, or past students studying at any TEQSA-registered higher education provider, including undergraduate and postgraduate students, with no time limit on historical complaints ([StudyAssist](https://www.studyassist.gov.au/news/national-student-ombudsman-commenced-1-february-2025)). The NSO can handle complaints about a broad range of issues, including student safety and welfare, course administration, teaching provision and facilities, disciplinary processes, and reasonable adjustments for students with disabilities ([Department of Education](https://www.education.gov.au/newsroom/articles/national-student-ombudsman-now-taking-complaints)).

### Overseas Students Ombudsman (OSO)

The Overseas Students Ombudsman (OSO) supports international students and investigates complaints about private education providers in Australia ([Office for Youth](https://www.youth.gov.au/education-and-training/international-students)). International students studying with a private provider should continue to contact the OSO for assistance ([Study Australia](https://www.studyaustralia.gov.au/en/tools-and-resources/news/the-new-national-student-ombudsman)). The OSO can investigate complaints about issues such as refusing admission to a course, cancelled courses, fees, and accommodation or work arranged by the provider ([Office for Youth](https://www.youth.gov.au/education-and-training/international-students)).

### Commonwealth Ombudsman

The Commonwealth Ombudsman can investigate complaints from international students about private schools, colleges, institutes, and universities in Australia ([Commonwealth Ombudsman](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)). Issues that can be investigated include course fees and refunds, transfers between courses or providers, intention to report to Home Affairs for unsatisfactory course progress or attendance, cancellation of enrolment, deferment and suspension of studies, incorrect advice given by an education agent, and the provider’s handling of complaints or appeals ([Commonwealth Ombudsman](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)).

### State and Territory Ombudsmen

Students studying a VET course with a public provider should continue to raise their complaint with their local State or Territory Ombudsman ([StudyAssist](https://www.studyassist.gov.au/news/national-student-ombudsman-commenced-1-february-2025)). Each state and territory has its own ombudsman office to handle these complaints ([Study Australia](https://www.studyaustralia.gov.au/en/tools-and-resources/news/the-new-national-student-ombudsman)).

### Complaint Handling Processes

The NSO does not make new decisions about complaints but assesses whether the education provider’s actions were fair and reasonable ([Study Australia](https://www.studyaustralia.gov.au/en/tools-and-resources/news/the-new-national-student-ombudsman)). Depending on the case, the NSO may make written recommendations to the provider, offer restorative engagement, or provide mediation or alternative dispute resolution options ([Study Australia](https://www.studyaustralia.gov.au/en/tools-and-resources/news/the-new-national-student-ombudsman)).

## Debunking Other Statements

*   **Students cannot complain about their agent to the OSO or State Ombudsman:** This statement is false. The Commonwealth Ombudsman can look into complaints from international students about incorrect advice given by an education agent ([Commonwealth Ombudsman](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)).
*   **If a student contacts the OSO, the police will never investigate the complaint:** This statement is false. Contacting the OSO does not preclude a police investigation if the complaint involves criminal activity. The OSO handles administrative complaints, while the police handle criminal matters.
*   **Students only have the right to complain in certain, specified circumstances:** This statement is misleading. While there are specific issues that ombudsmen can and cannot investigate, students have the right to complain about a wide range of issues related to their education provider's actions ([Commonwealth Ombudsman](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)).

## Detailed Explanation

The establishment of the NSO, OSO, and the roles of State and Territory Ombudsmen create a multi-layered system for handling student complaints. The primary intention is to ensure that students have access to independent and impartial bodies to resolve disputes with their education providers. However, the structure also implies a necessary progression:

1.  **Internal Complaint Process:** The student must first attempt to resolve the issue through the education provider's internal complaint mechanisms. This allows the provider an opportunity to address and rectify the problem directly.
2.  **External Ombudsman:** If the internal process fails to resolve the issue satisfactorily, the student can then escalate the complaint to the relevant ombudsman. The choice of ombudsman depends on the type of institution (public or private), the student's status (domestic or international), and the level of education (higher education or VET).

This tiered approach ensures that the ombudsman offices are not overwhelmed with complaints that could be resolved internally. It also encourages education providers to develop and maintain effective internal complaint resolution processes.

## Specific Examples

*   A domestic student enrolled in a Bachelor's degree at a university (a TEQSA-registered higher education provider) who is unhappy with the way their university handled a complaint about assessment grading should first go through the university's internal appeals process. If the student remains dissatisfied, they can then escalate the complaint to the NSO ([StudyAssist](https://www.studyassist.gov.au/news/national-student-ombudsman-commenced-1-february-2025)).
*   An international student studying a VET course at a public TAFE who has a complaint about course fees should first attempt to resolve the issue with the TAFE. If unsuccessful, they should then contact the ombudsman in their respective state or territory ([StudyAssist](https://www.studyassist.gov.au/news/national-student-ombudsman-commenced-1-february-2025)).
*   An international student studying at a private college who has a complaint about incorrect advice given by an education agent should first attempt to resolve the issue with the college. If unsuccessful, they can contact the Commonwealth Ombudsman ([Commonwealth Ombudsman](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)).

## Limitations and Considerations

It is important to note that the ombudsmen have specific jurisdictions and limitations. For example, the Commonwealth Ombudsman cannot investigate complaints about public education providers ([Commonwealth Ombudsman](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)). Similarly, the ombudsmen generally do not review the academic merit of grades or marks for assessment tasks ([Commonwealth Ombudsman](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)).

## Conclusion

In conclusion, the statement that a student must access the institution’s internal complaint process before contacting the OSO or State Ombudsman is the most accurate based on the provided information. The establishment of the NSO and the guidelines for international and VET students indicate a tiered approach to complaint resolution, starting with the education provider's internal processes. This ensures that the ombudsman offices are not overwhelmed with complaints that could be resolved internally and encourages education providers to develop effective internal complaint resolution processes.

## References

Commonwealth Ombudsman. (n.d.). *International student complaints*. [https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints](https://www.ombudsman.gov.au/complaints/international-student-complaints)

Department of Education. (2025, February 1). *National Student Ombudsman now taking complaints*. [https://www.education.gov.au/national-student-ombudsman/announcements/national-student-ombudsman-now-taking-complaints](https://www.education.gov.au/national-student-ombudsman/announcements/national-student-ombudsman-now-taking-complaints)

Department of Education. (2025, February 4). *National Student Ombudsman now taking complaints*. [https://www.education.gov.au/newsroom/articles/national-student-ombudsman-now-taking-complaints](https://www.education.gov.au/newsroom/articles/national-student-ombudsman-now-taking-complaints)

Office for Youth. (n.d.). *International students*. [https://www.youth.gov.au/education-and-training/international-students](https://www.youth.gov.au/education-and-training/international-students)
